title: LAS VEGAS EROTIC DANCE CODE REGULATION CRIME STATISTICS

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: LAS VEGAS EROTIC DANCE CODE REGULATION CRIME STATISTICS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting raw crime statistics concerning Las Vegas municipal code (LVMC) 6.35.100 involving Erotic Dance Establishment regulations, specifically raw numerical data including ALL alleged “fondle or caress” violations pursuant to LVMC 6.35.100(I) since the ordinance was enacted in 1995.

I request the exact number of citations/tickets/charges issued by the Las Vegas Metro Police EACH YEAR for alleged violations of LVMC 6.35.100(I).  I request the number of such alleged violations for EACH YEAR from 1995 to 2022. I am specifically not requesting that any new record(s) be created, but specifically do request raw data (public record crime statistics) in an electronic format be provided by means of an electronic medium. No confidential information is requested.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Colin

title: DASNY's Role in the Development of New York's Cannabis Marketplace

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: DASNY's Role in the Development of New York's Cannabis Marketplace
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I am requesting access to and copies of records related to the Dormitory Authority of the State of New York's (DASNY) role in the development of the state's cannabis marketplace, specifically the Conditional Adult-Use Retail Dispensary (CAURD) program and the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund.

The specific records I seek include, but are not limited to:

1. The number of DASNY staff members allocated to the CAURD program or cannabis-related activities.
2. The portion of DASNY's budget allocated to the cannabis program.
3. Updated figures on the expenditure of the state's $50 million pledge for the CAURD program.
4. Details of the $5 million loan program announced in June 2023, including its source of funding.
5. The updated term sheet for Social Equity Impact Ventures' involvement in the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund, including details of the management fee.
6. All communications, contracts, and agreements related to the selection of Chicago Atlantic as the investor for the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund.
7. Any records related to the questions listed in the article "The questions DASNY will not answer about NY cannabis" published on Syracuse.com.

Please note that according to the New York State Archives' General Retention and Disposition Schedule for New York State Government Records (LGS-01), many of these records should be retained and available for public access.

If any of the requested records are not available or are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation for each individual record denied or redacted, citing the specific statutory exemption(s) you believe justify the refusal to release the information.

I look forward to your prompt response within five business days, as required by law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: E-470 Public Highway Authority Contract Staff Names, Titles, and Hourly Rates

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: E-470 Public Highway Authority Contract Staff Names, Titles, and Hourly Rates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For each contractor, temporary employee, and/or contingent worker contracted with the E-470 Public Highway Authority, for any time between January 1, 2023, to the date of this requests filing.
       Full legal given name(s) and surname(s) of each individual.
       Title or role held by each individual during their contract period.
       Contract or hourly rate paid to the employee's employer for each individual. Additionally, please provide the rate provided to the employee (if different from the employer's rate).
       The employing agency or business name associated with each individual.

I understand no single given record may contain all of the above information. Please provide any combination of documents necessary to provide the requested information. I am not requesting the creation of any new records. 

Please note, Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S § 24-72-203(3.5)(d) : Altering an existing public record, or excising fields of information pursuant to this subsection (3.5) to remove information that the custodian is either required or permitted to withhold, does not constitute the creation of a new public record.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Advocate

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/07/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148899 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013906-070723 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 
Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R001284-070623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/07/2023 

Rose Terse 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148894 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 06, 2023, Reference # R001284-070623 

Dear Rose Terse, 

This letter is to inform you that your public records request was received in this office on July 06, 2023. 

Unfortunately your request does not identify a specific record. As per RCW 42.56.520(3)(a) since your request for records is unclear our office will not be able to accept your public records request as written, we require clarification before searching for any records. 
Please clarify the following: What Department or Office are you wishing to receive records from? Your request currently reads "All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office." Ferry County Public Records does not hold or maintain a Brady List but the Ferry County Prosecuting Attorney's Office may. 

A request under the Public Records Act must be for an identifiable public record, see Hangartner v. City of Seattle, 151 Wn.2d 439, 447-48, 90 P.3d 26 (2004), and a mere request for information does not so qualify. Wood v. Lowe, 102 Wn.App. 872, 879, 10 P.3d 494 (2000); Bonamy v. City of Seattle, 92 Wn.App. 403, 410-12, 960 P.2d 447 (1998), review denied, 137 Wn.2d 1012 (1999). Local governments are not required to create documents in order to comply with a request for specific information. Citizens for Fair Share v. State Dep’t of Corrections, 117 Wn.App. 411, 435, 72 P.3d 206 (citing Smith v. Okanogan County, 100 Wn.App. 7, 13-14 (2000)). See also WAC 44-14-04003(5). Nor are local governments obligated to compile information from various records so that information is in a form that is more useful to the requestor. Instead, they must produce existing records for review and copying. 

As per RCW 42.56.520(3)(b) if you fail to respond to our request for clarification within 15 days from the date of this letter, we will presume your request has been abandoned and we will close our file. 

Sincerely, 
Marah Hulse 
Ferry County Public Records Officer 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Ferry County Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HRz4NkQVz8GwY1vUjSAVtMrdixSCw-2Fr0ymw2asTQTJAITBaTiyBECtTRBJcH8R4TxGtjRjk9W4y7MnX9Ji6Qos5UwkKOhULcwkLeO9gRsTR5ezoG_122GdlcTw0sOmm1Kyp7OpLYiMu4-2BQFR2WV1Lgz3Lj-2B2PHruQzW69bKeJnHk2vUPr-2FbLul7n84oNlnscZL3Zj4bJXze77R5Xze68bhGVo9Y8uEkjxeK1UhnoYahb0kq-2FSF32H7CD8Lpi7ej2eqSXrwoJRhQd3Xwl9ErSHajjtDXb-2BOvb4skmHy-2FNYWRYxNK7bY8OEz2ing9dtoKyt48mLGC2Fe2H4U-2FpALxpUOa25mMynQvdoNq3DhggmsWLYZln-2BGUatqzVRa4RBK8B9m-2FGc3ZipgKqfGgrMGOSEa19OkoUgiBPC-2BUQP4X4fRWsgqr-2BIk0HdfgR8U4DPwGtLXhSJ-2FmgE5AvYRvqMl41InK8rAHaH6zMVBYPP2BMOxbHfY7Kr80JnNLTTu80hRbUCa-2FKshg-3D-3D)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

The FBI said to use file number 94-HQ-4-4467 as a reference.

https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-file-brigid-berlin-148599/#files

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SS Activation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

On 12/25/22 at around 12:13: AM PST ShotSpotter technology detected a possible round of gunfire near 1619 51st Ave in Oakland. According to dispatch audio, officers with OPD responded to the scene and pursued a suspect on foot.  At 12:21 (near 1231 51st Ave), they had the suspect in custody.  I am looking for records that indicate the number of officers who responded to this incident, and, if any exist, investigative reports and body camera footage from the officers who responded.  I am also looking for any arrest reports.

I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED. Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

On 12/31/22 at around 8:25 PM EST ShotSpotter technology detected a possible round of gunfire near 111 E McMicken Ave. According to dispatch audio, officers with CPD Police advised there may have been a man firing shots in the area standing on the South East corner of McMicken Avenue and Walnut Street. They engaged this suspect in a pursuit. I am looking for records that indicate the number of officers who responded to this incident, and, if any exist, investigative reports and body camera footage from the officers who responded.  I am also looking for any arrest reports.

I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED. Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record.

If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me at dhruv_mehrotra@wired.com. Conde Nast's legal counsel is also copied on this letter. We look forward to a response as quickly as possible under applicable law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Buzz the Security Bee
communications.communication:
Dear Department of Commerce, Office of Security (OSY):

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to Buzz the Security Bee, OSY's "security mascot" for the U.S. Census Bureau's National Processing Center in Jeffersonville, Indiana. According to the attached archived OYS website, Buzz was introduced in late 2006 and was developed to spread security awareness. The contact person on the website is Debra Rochner, so she may be one person to ask about responsive records (if she is still with the agency) or whose files or correspondence may have responsive records.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Buzz the Security Bee mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to OYS's decision to create a security mascot in the first place.

2. Please produce all Buzz-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books). Please include any related contracts or correspondence.

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Buzz costume that may have been created. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Buzz.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Buzz (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Tom Coburn (R-OK) may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007, and Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some around 2019.

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using the Buzz mascot.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: File Requests
communications.communication:
Good afternoon –

Body camera video is private data pursuant to Minn. Stat. 13.825 Subd.2.  We cannot publicly release the body camera video.  Additionally, we are unable to release any video/audio recordings.  As directed by our City Attorney, this is still considered an active investigation because of the appeals process that can happen after conviction so, investigative data is confidential under Minn. Stat. § 13.82 subd. 7. It would be by the determination of the Hennepin County Attorney’s Office as to when that information can be released.

Thank you,

Jessica Rasmussen
Office Manager
Orono Police Department


Minn. Stat. 13.82 Subd. 7.Criminal investigative data.



Except for the data defined in subdivisions 2, 3, and 6, investigative data collected or created by a law enforcement agency in order to prepare a case against a person, whether known or unknown, for the commission of a crime or other offense for which the agency has primary investigative responsibility are confidential or protected nonpublic while the investigation is active. Inactive investigative data are public unless the release of the data would jeopardize another ongoing investigation or would reveal the identity of individuals protected under subdivision 17. Images and recordings, including photographs, video, and audio records, which are part of inactive investigative files and which are clearly offensive to common sensibilities are classified as private or nonpublic data, provided that the existence of the images and recordings shall be disclosed to any person requesting access to the inactive investigative file. An investigation becomes inactive upon the occurrence of any of the following events:

(a) a decision by the agency or appropriate prosecutorial authority not to pursue the case;

(b) expiration of the time to bring a charge or file a complaint under the applicable statute of limitations, or 30 years after the commission of the offense, whichever comes earliest; or

(c) exhaustion of or expiration of all rights of appeal by a person convicted on the basis of the investigative data.

Any investigative data presented as evidence in court shall be public. Data determined to be inactive under clause (a) may become active if the agency or appropriate prosecutorial authority decides to renew the investigation.

During the time when an investigation is active, any person may bring an action in the district court located in the county where the data are being maintained to authorize disclosure of investigative data. The court may order that all or part of the data relating to a particular investigation be released to the public or to the person bringing the action. In making the determination as to whether investigative data shall be disclosed, the court shall consider whether the benefit to the person bringing the action or to the public outweighs any harm to the public, to the agency or to any person identified in the data. The data in dispute shall be examined by the court in camera.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NYC location data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All records of scheduled meetings between CobWebs Technologies representatives and the Queens District Attorney's office, including but not limited to Angelica Quintero, a senior purchasing employee at the District Attorney's office from January 1, 2022 to the present including any written or recorded notes from the meetings.

2) All records of scheduled meetings between CobWebs Technologies representatives and Queens District Attorney's office public information or media relations department from January 1, 2022 to the present including any written or recorded notes from the meetings

3) All email exchanges -- including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments -- between the Queens DA Melinda Katz and other members of the DA's office and CobWebs Technologies representatives from January 1, 2022 to the present. CobWebs Technologies representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@cobwebs.com"

4) All emails exchanges–including incoming messages, outgoing messages, forwards, and attachments–between the department's public information and/or media relations staff members and CobWebs representatives from January 1, 2022 to the present. CobWebs representatives can be identified by searching the department's email system for addresses ending in "@cobwebs.com"

5) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the DA's use of CobWebs products WebLoc and Tangles. This includes A) any notes taking during meetings that discussed the use of CobWebs programs WebLock and Tangles, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how these programs works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of these programs to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

I ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to further public understanding of government functions and not for any commercial purpose.

In the event that you choose to withhold or redact the records, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation of the statutory and/or case law upon which each rejection or redaction is based.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Johana Bhuiyan

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Johana Bhuiyan

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1)All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video (i.e., Google Meet/Hangouts, Zoom, etc.) between the Pittsburgh Pirates and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
2) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between Major League Baseball (MLB) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office .
3) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between the Major League Baseball Player's Association (MLBPA) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
4) All internal correspondence (including email, phone, fax, or video) regarding the Pittsburgh Pirates, MLB, and MLBPA.

Between the dates 06/26/2023 and the date this request is received.

If you determine that any information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary and, if so, whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: holler@bwd.nyc) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM. I am also available via phone at 718.360.6359 to discuss any questions you have about the request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bradford William Davis

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.

07/05/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148622 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013893-070423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
(x ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Ana Diaz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Board + Leadership Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Jianan Shi, former teacher at Solorio Academy
*Stacy Davis Gates, previous CPS teacher, current CTU president
*Kaitlyn Girard, current Chief of Labor Relations
*Camie Pratt, current Chief Title IX Officer

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani
